question_text: A laptop has both a wired and wireless NIC. What does this imply?
answer_options: The device can only connect to one network at a time
Both NICs will share the same MAC address
Each NIC will have its own MAC address
One NIC is for the CPU and one for the GPU
correct_answer: Each NIC will have its own MAC address
explanation: Every network interface (wired or wireless) has its own unique MAC address to identify it on the network.
